postcontent:
This is a cut down model 1816 musket that I picked up that I was going to use for a project that never came to fruition. title: For Sale:  Zastava M85 AK "pistol" with folding brace, MWI Rail and more!
postcontent:
I sort of lost my mind tricking this little gun out. I wanted a folding gun that would fit in a gym bag that I could keep in the car without having to go through the hassle of filing an SBR. 

This PAP has the M4 adapter so that it can use normal AK magazines with no problems, and it puts the mag release in the familiar place for AR users. It has a Midwest Industries rail made especially for this gun that is a rock solid mounting surface. I did not like the AK brace, and I wanted it to fold so I got a US Machine Gun Folding Stock adapter for AK's and fitted an Sig Brace to it. This is a great folding system, and is all metal and very solid.  It also has a Tapco double hook trigger and trigger retaining place so a nice smooth pull and no trigger slap.  To top it off it has a Hogue grip and a Krinkov style flash suppressor.

This gun shoots great, eats anything and is a ton of fun. Most everyone at the range things it is an SBR Krink clone. It has about 200 rounds through it so far. If you built it yourself, you would be in for about 1k, so I think I am asking a fair price. F2F with VA resident non-felons only. Will meet within about 45-60 minutes of Charlottesville. Not looking for trades at this time. Please check out my other listings!

title: For Sale:  Everything to reload .223
postcontent:
I've gotten a lot of use out of everything here, but for various reasons reloading doesn't fit my situation as well as it used to. I'm selling it all in one bulk lot, I don't want to deal with the hassle of parting it out. If you only want one component, buy the lot and sell what you don't need. It's everything needed to reload .223/5.56 - tools, components, and information (reloading books).

The photos/organization aren't ideal, but here's the basic rundown of what's included:
* Vibratory tumbler, 5lbs of corn media, and 1 bottle of nufinish (makes for very clean, very shiny brass)
* 8lb of IMR4895 and ~1lb of Reloader15
* ~1500 .224 bullets, ranging from 55gr to 77gr - mostly Hornady, but some Sierra/Nosler match bullets
* ~5k rounds of .223/5.56 brass - some primed, some cleaned, some dirty. Some .45acp and 9mm brass is thrown in, but not much.
* Lyman and Lee reloading books
* Redding powder trickler
* Lee Turret press (auto-indexing). Comes with .223 dies, universal decapper with spare pins, and auto powder drop
* ~ 3,000 small rifle primers
* Various misc tools/supplies to support reloading operations
* Composite digital calipers
* Analog powder scale 

Plenty more photos available upon request, Armslist only allows for 3 at a time.

title: For Sale:  Colt LE901 -16S 901 .308 Carbine w/ Conversion Kit
postcontent:
Be it prairie dog hunting in Texas, whitetail hunting in Maine or elk hunting in Colorado, the Colt LE901-16S™ is the rifle for the hunt. At first glance you would think that the Colt 901 is just a .308 Win./7.62 NATO version of a standard AR-15, much like any other .308 AR out there, but it is a lot more than that. The Colt LE901-16S is a “Modular Carbine,” which means it can be adapted to any AR-15 platform upper. This isn’t a new concept, because there are of course a whole bunch of different caliber uppers for ARs. The difference is in all the other ones, they have adapted a standard size AR magazine to boutique calibers and cartridge designs. The Colt 901 is different. It can be adapted from .308/7.62, using standard P-Mags, to .223/5.56, using standard AR mags, and back again, in literally seconds. The design uses one proprietary part, and you have to swap out the recoil system. It is that simple, and it works fantastic.

Exceptional accuracy is assured by its full floated, 16.1” chrome lined barrel and one-piece monolithic upper receiver, suitable for mounting your optic of choice. The fact that most of the operating controls are ambidextrous, including the magazine release and bolt catch makes for versatility and ease of use. You can depend on the new Colt LE901-16S to take the shot of your lifetime!

Features
Full Floated Barrel
Bayonet Lug and Flash Hider
Ambidextrous Magazine & Bolt Release
Vltor Buttstock
Accepts Mil-Spec 5.56 Colt Uppers
.308 Win / 5.56 (with conversion)
16 " Barrel Legnth
BUIS Flip-up Frount & Rear
37.5" EXTENDED LENGTH
34.24" COLLAPSED LENGTH
9.4 lbs WEIGHT

title: For Sale:  **Reduced!!!** LNIB PS90 with Red Dot and Magazines and ammo
postcontent:
Like new in box PS90 up for sale or trade for the right firearm. This rifle has only had 80 rounds down the pipe and comes with a 50 round and 30 round magazine. I have also attached and sighted in a Simmons Red Dot sight for the rifle and will include 120 rounds with the weapon. The 5.7x28mm round is extremely light recoiling and very fun to shoot and the rifle is completely ambidextrous. Both the charging handle and safety is available from either side and the cases eject from straight down. The Federal ammo for this rifle only costs $23 for a box of 50, so it costs about the same as a .45 acp pistol to shoot. The gun itself is a dream to shoot as it can easily stay on target for all 50 rounds with minimal adjustment since it recoils like a 22lr. Standing and firing rapidly (2-3 shots per second) at 25 yards you can easily make a grouping of less than 2 inches. The trigger also suffers from none of the common bullpup issues and gives most other triggers a run for their money. All original papers, box, and lock will come with this rifle as well. The weapon also breaks down in less than a minute and is very easy to clean and maintain. I can be reached by the contact seller button or by text (preferred) or phone at REDACTED.

title: For Sale:  FI Model D Colt Pony Mni 1911 .380
postcontent: This is an FI MODEL D, Cal .380, also known as a Colt Pony (Armslist does not have a category for FI [Firearms International]), with one original magazine. Made in Washington, DC, these mini 1911 had an interesting history but this web site gives the background better than I can explain: http://www.star-firearms.com/firearms/guns/d/index.shtml. Made by or for Colt, Star, Iver Johnson and FI. Locked breach and all steel consruction. Serial number CPA 023***(Colt Pony Automatic = CPA). In the middle 1970s, Colt decided to offer a .380 auto, and chose to partner with Star. The gun (to be called the Pony) was to be assembled in the US, presumably by Colt, from a Star DK slide & associated internals, with a U.S. made frame. Mechanical condition is excellent. No operational issues, and everything works as it should. I have shot cleaned and lubed it so it's tested and ready.Asking 350 or best offer. Text or call at 8 six 4 5 six 1 six 3 4 six.

title: For Trade:  New 5.56mm ammo for EOTech G33 magnifier
postcontent: I'm looking for the G33 magnifier by EOTech - no exceptions, no knock-offs. If you have a nice one (clean/no damage) you don't want or need, and you're willing to trade it for 5.56mm ammo (either 55gr or 62gr "green tip"), email me and let me know how much ammo you want for your G33. All my ammo is Federal Lake City factory-loaded, brass-cased on 10-rd stripper clips. The head stamps are all either 2013 and 2014. title: For Sale:  Gun Trust Services - Hanna Law P.C.
location: Serving all of Colorado, Denver, Colorado
postcontent:
Hanna Law P.C offers gun trust services to all of Colorado, and offers two levels of service: Basic Gun Trust for $225 and Comprehensive Gun Trust for $500

Are you looking to build an SBR? Maybe you're purchasing your first suppressor? A gun trust offers you a great deal of convenience when you own these items.

Hanna Law P.C. is a different kind of law firm, specializing in firearms trusts. We do not operate on a normal business week schedule, but can accommodate your needs on your schedule. We are available during the day and in the evening as well as weekends.

We understand that buying an NFA item can be a lengthy process, so we strive to offer great service with a short turnaround.

We offer two levels of trust:
Basic Gun Trust $225 - fast and easy, convenient for those who do not wish to speak at great lengths with the attorney. If you e-mail your info and give us a call, everything can be handled in person very quickly. Notary services provided at time of delivery.

Comprehensive Gun Trust $500 - Also fast, however, the attorney will meet with you and discuss all the provisions of the trust. If you do not like specific provisions, need clarification on certain provisions, or would like to add or remove provisions, this is the level for you. Generally it takes 1.5-2 hours of face time with the attorney to go over the entire document. Notary services provided during meeting. This is a good option for those who are unfamiliar with firearms trusts, and demand extensive clarification. Some people are a bit nervous when starting their NFA item collection, and face-time with an informed attorney can put some of these concerns to rest.

For various reasons, you may wish to also put your Title I (regular) firearms into your trust as well. We also offer this service.

We wish you the best on your journey into the land of SBR's, AOW's, SBS's, and suppressors. They can be great home defense weapons, and sure are a whole lot of fun to shoot at the range. We hope to hear from you soon. Feel free to call at 720-568-0564. Leave us a voicemail with your number and a good time to return your call, and we will get back to you promptly. You can also e-mail us at info@hannalawpc.com.

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Hanna-Law-PC/343663382467139

title: For Sale/Trade:  VOTE NO ON I-594
location: EVERYWHERE IN WASHINGTON, Washington, United States
postcontent:
JUST VOTE NO ON I-594  I don't know what to think about I-591 after reading this...

A timely warning to WA state Freepers
Facebook ^  | 09/28/2014 | Anonymous 

Posted on Sunday, September 28, 2014 9:11:52 PM by Robwin

There is SO much emphasis on I-594, but there is NO discussion on I-591. WHY? 594 is an obvious attempt to violate the 2nd amendment by infringing on our rights to obtain or even transfer firearms. The bill is totally ludicrous. But I-591 is a Trojan horse. IT does prevent the confiscation of guns without due process, but the second part opens us to onslaught by Mike Bloomberg & Co. The second part of 591 no background checks can be required of recipients “UNLESS A UNIFORM NATIONAL STANDARD IS REQUIRED.” It does not specify which entity would be the responsible for enacting such a standard. It's possible that any organization can develop and enact a standard and we would be required by voter approval of I-591 to submit to background checks in order to be a recipient of a gun. Any org., such as ATF, EPA, DOE, AMA, FDA, IRS, can enact a standard and we would have by default, voted FOR the background check. UNACCEPTABLE. This initiative has a great first half, but an unacceptable second half. We must get the discussion going on I-591 ASAP. IT has the capability to be as detrimental to our 2nd amendment rights as I-594. And don’t fool yourselves that it won’t happen. If 591 gets approved, the Bloomberg & Co. will stop at nothing to get a standard enacted, and we would be STUCK with it, BASED ON OUR OWN VOTING ACTIONS! Please, get the conversations going on this. It’s not too late. The sample ballot is available on County Auditor's sites. They have been sent to the military. Get the word to them. And get the discussion going on 591. IT is a Trojan horse that will have the background-demanding army swarming all over our state.

title: For Sale/Trade:  1995 Caprice Wagon LT1
location: west unity, oh 43570 hour west of toledo, Toledo, Ohio
postcontent:
Bought this one with the intent to fix it up, but I've given up. 
This is one of those that has as many good things as bad things.
It has a quiet, non smoking LT1
SUPER HIGH MILEAGE  336K, BUT, it runs strong, engine is quiet, doesn't smoke.
But, it idles rough.  It starts easily, shifts great, accelerates great, but it idles rough and low. Sometimes it stalls at an idle. Usually it starts right back up, except ONCE, it didn't want to restart, just cranked. About 5 minutes later it fired right up.  I don't want to mess with it.
 Has headers, MSD distributor
Interior is in nice shape, gauges work, power everything works BUT the front passenger window and rear drivers window go down crooked.  Needs wipers BUT new wipers come with it. 
 Heat works but AC doesn't.  The car looks great from a distance but up close you can see the chips and scratches, the cracks in the bumper, the places on the quarters where emblems used to be, worn out window tint. BUT, there are no dents, the glass and lights are all good and there is MINIMAL rust, and the bumpers are fiberglass and the cracks would be easy to repair.  there's a little rust at the bottom of the quarter panels and some bubbles in the passenger side wheel arch.  There is a crack in the tail gate.
 There is a squeak from the front left brake and occasionally the ABS light comes on.  No other trouble lights are on.
  Has a non gm reproduction impala ss grille as well as the original chrome caprice grille.  Back glass struts hold the glass  open, hood struts do NOT hold the hood open.  Aftermarket electric sunroof, looks like its supposed to be there. Doesn't leak.
Lots of work, but Lots of potential.  Doesn't idle well but it runs and drives strong.  
Could be a great car, comfortable, the power is nice, but I'm just not feeling it.
Would consider trades or partial trades

title: For Sale:  16 in Daniel Defense "Carbine length" 1/7 twist Chrome Lined barrel
postcontent:
Bought this to build a custom rifle but ended up just buying a DD from the factory.  The barrel came by itself, I added the A-Frame ft site post, Gas Tube and delta-nut assembly from a previous colt AR I had.  it has all you need to mount to an upper receiver.   Brand new never shot, price is kinda firm as this is a great deal.  Mine is marked as:  DD F MP 5.56 NATO 1/7

From Daniel Defense website on their barrels:


Daniel Defense is a leading manufacturer of barrels for the AR15/M4 platform. Daniel Defense currently offers barrels that are manufactured by either a button swage process or cold hammer forged. These processes are both very precise but very different all at the same time. All Daniel Defense barrels are HP and MPI tested, chrome lined, and heavy phosphate coated. Barrels chambered in 5.56mm have a threaded muzzle with 1/2x28 TPI while 6.8 SPC Barrels have a threaded muzzle with 5/8x24 TPI.

Daniel Defense has been constantly evolving the barrel identification markings, or Roll Marks, on these barrel to make them easier to identify. Below you will find a list and images of the roll marks that identify our button swage barrels and cold hammer forged barrels.

Button Swage Barrels
DDI 1/7 4150 MP
DD 4150 5.56 NATO 1/7
1X7 5.56 Nato

Cold Hammer Forged Barrels
DD 5.56 NATO 1/7
DD 5.56 NATO 1/7 MM/YY (born on date)

DD HP MP 5.56 NATO 1/7 MM/YY (born on date)
DD F MP 5.56 NATO 1/7 MM/YY (born on date)

title: For Sale:  Kel-Tec KSG shotgun - LIFETIME WARRANTY NIB
postcontent:
The KSG (Kel-Tec Shotgun) is Kel-Tec CNC’s first entry into the shotgun market. The size, shape, and design is similar to the currently available Kel-Tec RFB rifle, but the KSG ejects downward, instead of forward. The KSG weighs 6.9 lbs. and is as compact as legally possible with a 26.1” overall length and an 18.5” cylinder bore barrel. Even with this compact size, the internal dual tube magazines hold an impressive 12 rounds of 12 gauge 3” rounds in total (6 per tube). It can also reliably shoot shells as short as 1 3/4" up to the 3".
This simple and reliable pump action feeds from either the left or right tube. The feed side is manually selected by a lever located behind the trigger guard.

The pump includes an under picatinny rail for the mounting of a forward grip, a light, or a laser. The included top picatinny sight rail will accept many types of optics or iron sights. Forward and rear sling loops are built in, and a basic sling is included. The soft rubber butt pad helps to tame recoil.

The KSG receiver is made from hardened steel and includes the magazine tubes which have been welded in place. The grip and stock assembly is made of glass reinforced nylon (Zytel) and is easily disassembled by pushing out 2 pins, which store in 2 holes in the grip when removed. The barrel and pump assembly is removed by loosening the 2 front magazine tube nuts with a coin and sliding the assembly forward.


Caliber	12 gauge 3”
Barrel length	18.5"
Total capacity	6+6+1
Weight empty	6.9lbs
Weight loaded	8.5lbs
Length	26.1"
Height	7"

Brand new in the box with a LIFETIME WARRANTY

Can be shipped to your FFL for 30.00 insrured, or 7% local pick up tax.

title: For Sale:  TAP Gamma Plus Level 3 SAPI body armor plates, not heavy AR500 III
postcontent:
I purchased these ceramic 10"x12" rifle rated body armor plates, and many other items from a preppers estate. I bought 7 total plates. I am keeping two for my plate carrier, and shot one to test, so I have a total of 4 available. The one I shot stopped two 5.56 XM193, two- 5.56 M855 (steel core penetrator), and stopped one 30.06 (165gr SP). The second 30.06 was about 1/4" from the first one and did penetrate. These are top quality Level 3 body armor "stand-alone" plates. If you are considering AR500 plates, at around 8lbs EACH (with spall protection), then you should seriously reconsider. These Lvl 3 plates weigh about 2.6lbs each...That makes just over 5lbs for 2 plates, WHICH IS LESS THAN A SINGLE AR500 plate! I am selling each plate for $80. I live in Sparks, but will ship USPS Priority for $10 to lower 48 U.S. only. It is the buyers responsibility to ensure they can legally own these, they are not a felon or unable to legally own a firearm, AND ensure these are legal in their state. They are legal in NV. as long as you can legally own a firearm...

May trade for firearm(s)

location: Henderson, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
This is a cut down model 1816 musket that I picked up that I was going to use for a project that never came to fruition. The previous owner had done extensive cleaning to it, and broke off the top screw that holds the flint, as it was not by the looks of it the one that belonged in there. I have the top jaw. Barrel length right now is 37 1/2 inches total. total length of the musket overall is 52 1/2 inches. Barrel is marked with JS or partial US and GF P. title: For Sale:  ALL MATCHING - 1956 6 digit "Ghost" Chinese SKS
location: Georgetown County, Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
postcontent:
SEE BELOW FOR PICTURES.

For sale is a 6 digit "Ghost SKS".  I didn't make up the term "ghost sks" but if you want to learn more about them then it is a handy term to use as a search tool.  The term is dubbed for the earliest Chinese SKS rifles before any distinguishing markings were put on the Chinese SKS's.  From what I've read the "ghost SKS" was produced in 1956.  This has all numbers matching including the stock.  Would make a great collectable, shooter, or project gun.  Has a like new mirror bore.  I have already cleaned all the cosmoline off and fired it.  It functioned perfectly with the cheap wolf ammo that I have.  
I have a ton of pictures from before and after I cleaned it.  This is a real military SKS, not a commercial rifle.  This was produced by China during the years of increasing tension in Vietnam before America became formally involved in the Vietnam War.  These were some of the first SKS's China produced for its military.
$400 cash FTF
If shipped then price is PRICE + $20 (for shipping).
